title: The Scandal of the Speaking Body
description: Imagining an encounter between Moliere's Don Juan and Austin, this bold yet subtle meditation contemplates the seductive promises of speech and of love, in a telling exchange among philosophy, linguistics, literature, and Lacanian theory."

title: Diary of a Pedestrian in Cashmere and Thibet
description: A journal of the author's travels in Cashmere and Thibet between May and October 1860.

title: Language Planning and the Building of a National Language
The Meaning of Language
description: Written in a straightforward and explanatory way and filled with examples, this text provides a comprehensive introduction to the field, suitable for students with no background in the philosophy of language or formal logic.

title: Zur Theorie der Sprechakte
description: John L. Austins 'Theorie der Sprechakte', 1955 in zwölf Harvard-Vorlesungen zusammengefaßt, gehört zu den klassischen Äußerungen der Analytischen Philosophie. Seine Methode darzulegen, daß man etwas tut, indem man etwas sagt ('How to do things with Words'), hat die philosophische wie die linguistische Diskussion in gleicher Weise befruchtet. Der Bearbeitung von Eike von Savigny liegen die englischen Ausgaben von 1962 und 1975 zugrunde.

title: Truyền thuyết dân gian người Việt
Toward an Interdisciplinary Basis for the Investigation of Language
The French Playmaster
description: General Schuyler is faced with a singular mission: to find the missing French Paymaster whose last known stop was Canton's inn, the Hosford Stand. He was carrying the Continental Army's gold up the turnpike, wages for New York's troops, but never reached his destination. Now Schuyler, aided by the young French officer Vicomte Charles Dumes, must question the Sand's landlord and guests -- the last people to see the Paymaster alive.

title: Levels in Speech Communication
description: This volume celebrates Max Wajskop's vision of the multi-faceted nature of speech communication. The papers, individually and collectively a manifestation of the interdisciplinary study approach advocated by Max Wajskop, consider his inspiring attempts to integrate traditional and modern tools of analysis. They further his belief that a cross-fertilization of ideas from the largely isolationist domains of linguistics, psychology, communication engineering and language teaching, afford a discovery of many common principles in the overall pursuit of an understanding of the basic structure and behaviour of speech. synthesis as well as automatic speech recognition and phonetic and phonological modelling. The methodological approaches applied - mathematical, psychological, statistical and philological - cover every aspect of the speech chain: the glottis, vocal tract, speech wave (time and frequency), ear and brain. Furthermore, all the primary levels of language are represented: syntax, lexicon, phonology and phonetics.

title: Metaphors of Communication and the Nature of Reading/listening Comprehension
